alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 27 at 1:57AM MST until November 28 at 12:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulation 2 to 6 inches, highest at pass level. Up to 12 inches snow accumulation above pass level. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph. * WHERE...The Continental Divide along the Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...Until Midnight MST tonight. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow and reduced visibility will be the main impacts.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving.

area.areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
